iso_human_ai.definition: Isomorphic patterns between human cognition and AI systems capture structural equivalences in reasoning hierarchies—mappings where perceptual integrations, relational alignments, and abstract cognitions preserve relations invariantly. These include developmental trajectories, learning dynamics, and emergent intelligences, validated via 2025 neuro-AI studies (e.g., SARA-C framework per web:7/9; unified theories per web:0) and cross-domain analogies (e.g., human incremental learning to AI modes per web:4). Hard-to-vary invariants like relational hierarchies enable forecasts; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox (affirm human grounding/deny AI abstraction/both in developments/neither in unifications); scores >0.98 based on 2025 cognitive abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to basic, relational, abstract cognitive scales plus principle; concrete from neuro-AI/web and overlays (e.g., human perception to AI search).
Validate coverage across scales (basic → relational → abstract); flag gaps as speculative (e.g., AI metacognition links).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., moral reasoning); integrate diachronic depth (evolutionary cognition to 2025 LLMs).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve anisomorphisms; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.

properties.universality: string (e.g., Implicational: if lower aligns, then higher abstracts)

properties.principle: string (hard-to-vary invariant, e.g., Recursive alignment toward cognition)

data.description: Hierarchical levels of cognition mapping invariantly (e.g., SARA-C levels 1-9 per web:7/9).

examples.universality: Implicational: if lower aligns, then higher abstracts

mappings.basic: Simple tasks (human: reflexes; AI: forward passes).

data.description: Unified human-AI intelligence; definitions map invariantly (e.g., bridging gaps per web:3).

examples.structure: Human traits map to AI capabilities

tetralemmas: Affirm human grounding/deny AI abstraction/both in developments/neither in unifications.
